column2: as Terry said, to the nuts. It had been a beautiful Thanksgiving dinner so far." Grandmother's sweet face beamed down the length of the great table
column3: over all the little crinkly grandheads
column4: at grandfather's face. Everybody felt very thankful."I wish all the children this side o' the north pole had had some turkey
column7: said Silence quietly. Silence was always wishing beautiful things like that.An' some nuts
column8: added Terry, setting his small white teeth into the meat of a big fat walnut. It wouldn't seem Thanksgivingy 'thout nuts.""I know somebody who would be thankful with just nuts
column10: I think he'd rather have them for all the courses of his Thanksgiving dinner!""Just nuts! No turkey
column12: nor anything?"The crinkly grandheads all bobbed up from their plates and nut-pickers in amazement. Just nuts!"Yes. Guess who he is?" Grandfather's laughing eyes twinkled up the long table at grandmother.
